meanings.sent1: The elephant was gargantuan compared to the tiny mouse.
meanings.sent2: The gargantuan cake towered over the other desserts at the party.
meanings.sent3: The gargantuan pumpkin won first prize at the fair for its size.
meanings.sent4: Her appetite was gargantuan, devouring everything in sight.
meanings.sent5: The gargantuan mountain loomed in the distance, casting a shadow over the valley.

meanings.definition: Of immense size, volume, or capacity.
meanings.sent1: The gargantuan ship could carry thousands of passengers across the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The gargantuan library housed millions of books on its shelves.
meanings.sent3: The gargantuan sandwich was so big, it took two people to finish it.
meanings.sent4: His gargantuan collection of stamps filled an entire room in his house.
meanings.sent5: The gargantuan waves crashed against the shore, creating a deafening roar.
